jot.io.sound.handlers

Class Sound3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • jot.io.sound.handlers.Sound3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sound

    public class Sound3D
extends Object
implements Sound
    Class that implements the JOAL sound handler.
    Author:
    G. Amador & A. Gomes

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public boolean load(String filePath,
                    String fileName,
                    boolean toLoop)
        Method to load a sound nm.
        Specified by:
        load in interface Sound
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path to the file to load.
        fileName - the name of the file content to load.
        toLoop - parameter to set sound to play once or in loop.
        Returns:
        TRUE if sound already loaded, FALSE otherwise.

      • load

        public boolean load(String filePath,
                    String fileName,
                    float x,
                    float y,
                    float z,
                    boolean toLoop)
        A variant of load(), which employs setPos()
        Parameters:
        filePath - to the sound to load.
        fileName - of the sound to load.
        x - Cartesian coordinate of the sound source.
        y - Cartesian coordinate of the sound source.
        z - Cartesian coordinate of the sound source.
        toLoop - TRUE if the sound when finished is to be restarted, FALSE otherwise.
        Returns:
        TRUE if a sound emitter was successfully created in the provided position in Cartesian coordinates, FALSE otherwise.

      • getGain

        public float getGain(String soundId)
        Method to get the gain/volume of a given sound. The gain/volume is between [0;1].
        Specified by:
        getGain in interface Sound
        Parameters:
        soundId - the identifier of the sound.
        Returns:
        the gain/volume in the interval [0;1] of the sound.

      • setGain

        public void setGain(String soundId,
                    float gain)
        Method to set the gain/volume of a given sound. The gain/volume is between [0;1], numbers outside this interval are set to the closest interval extrema.
        Specified by:
        setGain in interface Sound
        Parameters:
        soundId - the identifier of the sound.
        gain - the gain/volume to set the sound.

      • getPitch

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Specified by:
        setPitch in interface Sound
        Parameters:

                      float x,
                      float y,
                      float z)
        Move the fileName sound to (x,y,z).
        Parameters:
        fileName - of the file to move.
        x - Cartesian coordinate.
        y - Cartesian coordinate.
        z - Cartesian coordinate.
        Returns:
        TRUE if sound was moved, FALSE otherwise.
